edu.ufl.cise.sarunach.dijikstra

Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ufl.cise.sarunach.dijikstra.Graph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGraph
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TestableGraph

    public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
implements IGraph
    Class to represent a graph with vertices, edges and edge costs.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Graph()
      Default constructor.
      Graph(short n)
      Constructor that allocates memory.
      Graph(short n, double d, short s)
      Constructor to be used when generating a graph with randomized inputs.

      • Graph

        public Graph()
        Default constructor.

      • Graph

        public Graph(short n)
        Constructor that allocates memory.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of vertices

      • Graph

        public Graph(short n,
     double d,
     short s)
      throws java.lang.Exception
        Constructor to be used when generating a graph with randomized inputs. The density calculation is always performed to create ceil of the max edges when encountered with decimals-Assumption.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of vertices
        d - density of the graph
        s - source vertex
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when the density is too low to generate a connected graph.
